requirements_checklist.requirement: Mandatory attendance required for all vendors submitting a bid at Pre-Proposal Conference.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Attendance is unknown, therefore, the requirement is not confirmed as met.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Minimum three (3) years of business in Temporary Staffing Services at the time of bid due date.
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFQXpert established in 2020 and the RFP is due in 2025, fulfilling the 3-year requirement.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Must demonstrate financial stability (Annual Report, CPA Solvency Letter, etc.).
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFQXpert has a credit rating of 'A', a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.8, a current ratio of 2.5, and bank references, indicating financial stability.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Must comply with all specified legal requirements.
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFQXpert has licenses, E-Verify, and conducts background checks, suggesting compliance with legal requirements.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Provide temporary employees of indefinite quantities on an as-needed, non-exclusive basis.
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFQXpert provides temporary staffing services.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Workers must be >= 18 years old, sober, reliable, clean, appropriately dressed, able to follow instructions.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Assumed to be part of RFQXpert's Standard Operating Procedures.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Contractor must conduct background checks.
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFQXpert conducts background checks.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Return all keys upon assignment completion; Contractor bears cost of re-keying if keys are lost/not returned.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Presumed to be part of RFQXpert's standard procedures and can be implemented.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Comply with all State, Federal, Local Laws (incl. ADA, Title VII, ADEA, CRA 1991).
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFQXpert presumed to comply.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Contractor responsible for payroll, deductions, taxes, insurance, wages, benefits for its employees.
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFQXpert presumed to be compliant with this since they provide staffing services.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Comply with Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986. Use E-Verify if required by funding source.
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFQXpert uses E-Verify.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Adhere to MHMR's non-discrimination policy.
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFQXpert presumed to adhere.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Texas Public Information Act compliance.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Presumed. Requires legal and compliance review to confirm.

requirements_checklist.requirement: No Boycotting Israel certification (TX Gov Code).
requirements_checklist.explanation: Presumed. Requires legal and compliance review to confirm.

requirements_checklist.requirement: No Prohibited Business Operations certification (Sudan, Iran, Terrorist Orgs - TX Gov Code).
requirements_checklist.explanation: Presumed. Requires legal and compliance review to confirm.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Contractor must indemnify and hold harmless MHMR from suits, actions, claims, costs arising from contractor's negligence or wrongful acts.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Assumed to be included in contract agreement. Legal review needed to confirm.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Submission format, copies, delivery, address, deadline, envelope marking, signing, late proposals.
requirements_checklist.explanation: These are procedural and can be followed.

requirements_checklist.requirement: BackgroundChecks requirement mentioned in SpecificRequirements is met.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Background checks requirement mentioned in SpecificRequirements is met.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Ability to respond quickly to requests.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Presumed. Based on staffing and expertise.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Provide timesheets, completed weekly, approved by MHMR supervisor, attached to invoices.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Timesheet procedures can be implemented by the company.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Invoicing: Separate invoices per employee; include correct rates, position, start/end dates. Invoice weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly. Payment terms Net 30 minimum.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Invoicing procedures can be implemented by the company.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Proof of insurance (current COI) MUST be submitted WITH the proposal.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Employers Liability and Auto Liability insurance limits are less than the minimum required in the RFP.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Provide COI naming MHMR, its officers, employees, and elected representatives as additional insured.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Currently does not, COI will need to be updated.

requirements_checklist.requirement: HUB/DBE Utilization Assessment (If applicable, or indicate None)
requirements_checklist.explanation: Requires either HUB/DBE certification or demonstrating 'good faith' effort.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Assign a dedicated Project Manager for MHMR account.
requirements_checklist.explanation: Company data does not indicate a dedicated PM, but one could be assigned.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Provide copies of relevant licenses, certifications, permits.
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFQXpert has licenses and certifications but proof of copies not mentioned

requirements_checklist.requirement: Information Technology Audit Services
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFKXpert primarily offers staffing and HR services, not IT auditing.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Experience in school district information technology audits
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFKXpert has Government contracts experience, but no explicit mention of IT audits or school districts

requirements_checklist.requirement: Provide references from other school districts with IT audit experience
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFKXpert has References available, but not specifically for school districts or IT audits.

requirements_checklist.requirement: Sample technology audit report
requirements_checklist.explanation: RFKXpert has past performance reports likely available, but not a specific technology audit report.

compliance_status.summary: RFQXpert meets a majority of the basic requirements for the RFP, but several critical compliance gaps need to be addressed to be eligible and competitive. Major gaps exist around insurance coverage, HUB/DBE assessment, documentation submission, attendance at the pre-proposal conference, and IT audit services.
major_gaps: Lack of attendance confirmation at Mandatory Pre-Proposal Conference
Insufficient Insurance Coverage (Employer's Liability and Auto Liability)
Missing COI naming MHMR as Additional Insured
Missing copies of licenses, certifications and permits

recommendations.recommendation: Immediately confirm attendance at the Mandatory Pre-Proposal Conference or determine if alternative arrangements can be made.
recommendations.related_gap: Lack of attendance confirmation at Mandatory Pre-Proposal Conference

recommendations.recommendation: Increase Employers Liability and Auto Liability insurance coverage to meet the RFP's minimum requirements. Obtain a Certificate of Insurance (COI) that specifically names MHMR, its officers, employees, and elected representatives as additional insured.
recommendations.related_gap: Insufficient Insurance Coverage (Employer's Liability and Auto Liability), Missing COI naming MHMR as Additional Insured

recommendations.recommendation: Complete the HUB/DBE Utilization Assessment, documenting either HUB/DBE participation or demonstrating good faith efforts to include them. Document all efforts made.
Gather copies of all relevant licenses, certifications, and permits to submit with the proposal. Verify licenses and certifications are valid and up to date.
recommendations.related_gap: Missing copies of licenses, certifications and permits

recommendations.recommendation: Partner with an IT auditing firm or acquire an IT auditing company to fulfill this requirement. Alternatively, RFKXpert could develop internal IT auditing expertise through training and hiring specialized personnel. Subcontracting the IT specific portions of the audit is another viable option.  Highlight any transferable skills and experience from related projects. Emphasize experience with government entities and any experience with technology-related projects.   If partnering or subcontracting, leverage the partner's experience in this area.  If partnering or subcontracting, use the partner's school district references. If developing internal capabilities, pursue smaller IT audit projects with school districts to build a track record and generate relevant references. If partnering, use a sample report from the partner.  If developing capabilities internally, create a mock report demonstrating the proposed methodology and reporting format.

Assign a dedicated Project Manager for the MHMR account and ensure their availability to fulfill the contract requirements. Designate a primary point of contact for SRMT communications. Implement a system for tracking and managing action items. Schedule regular meetings with SRMT representatives to maintain open communication and address any concerns promptly.
Establish clear communication protocols and response times within the project team.
recommendations.related_gap: Ability to respond quickly to requests

recommendations.recommendation: Implement a comprehensive training plan for the SRMT program staff, with clear objectives, materials, and evaluation methods, to avoid risks in underestimating the training effort or ongoing support.
recommendations.related_gap: The RFP requires training for Tribal program staff to maintain websites.

recommendations.recommendation: Proactively verify RFQXpert's good standing in the SAM database and with the Department of Health & Human Services/Office of Inspector General. Implement internal controls to ensure ongoing compliance with these requirements. Maintain accurate records of compliance activities.
recommendations.related_gap: SRMT Corporate Compliance Policy involves screening against the Department of Health & Human Services/Office of Inspector General and The System for Award Management (SAM) exclusion database.

recommendations.recommendation: Verify that the team assigned to the project has expertise in Craft CMS 3. Highlight relevant experience and certifications in the proposal. Provide examples of successful projects using Craft CMS 3. If internal expertise is limited, consider partnering with a subcontractor who specializes in Craft CMS 3.
recommendations.related_gap: The SRMT currently uses Craft CMS 3, and the proposer must demonstrate knowledge and use of this CMS.

recommendations.recommendation: Engage legal counsel to confirm compliance with Texas Public Information Act, No Boycotting Israel certification, No Prohibited Business Operations certification, and contract indemnification clauses.
recommendations.related_gap: Texas Public Information Act compliance, No Boycotting Israel certification, No Prohibited Business Operations certification, Contract Indemnification

plan_of_action.description: Confirm Attendance at Pre-Proposal Conference or alternative arrangements.
Contact insurance provider to increase Employers Liability and Auto Liability coverage and obtain an updated COI naming MHMR as an additional insured.
Complete the HUB/DBE Utilization Assessment. If not HUB/DBE certified, start documenting 'good faith' efforts and ensure appropriate parties sign the form.
Gather copies of all relevant licenses, certifications, and permits. Verify they are valid and up-to-date.
Assign a dedicated Project Manager for the MHMR account.

Evaluate IT audit needs. Partner with IT auditing firm or acquire an IT auditing company to fulfill this requirement. Alternatively, RFKXpert could develop internal IT auditing expertise through training and hiring specialized personnel. Subcontracting the IT specific portions of the audit is another viable option
Engage Legal counsel to review and confirm Texas specific forms (Public Information, Anti-Boycott Israel and Business Operations Certifications).
